dcterms:creator: S. Baker
D. Scharstein
J. Lewis
S. Roth
M. Black
R. Szeliski
dcterms:description: The Middlebury benchmark is widely used for evaluating optical flow algorithms, providing ground truth data for various sequences. However, it is limited by the lack of object blur and complex nonrigid motion.
dcterms:title: Middlebury Benchmark

dcterms:creator: D. J. Butler
J. Wulff
G. B. Stanley
M. J. Black
dcterms:description: The Sintel dataset is based on a 3D animated film and provides long synthetic sequences with ground truth for optical flow evaluation. It includes inter-frame ground truth and geometric blur under different renderings.
dcterms:title: Sintel Dataset

dcterms:creator: A. Geiger
P. Lenz
R. Urtasun
dcterms:description: The KITTI dataset enables the evaluation of optical flow algorithms in real-world street scenes, but lacks nonrigid ground truth for long sequences.
dcterms:title: KITTI Dataset

dcterms:creator: R. Garg
A. Roussos
L. Agapito
dcterms:description: The Garg et al. dataset provides synthetic video sequences with ground truth by projecting scene motion onto an image plane, focusing on non-rigid sequences.
dcterms:title: Garg et al. Dataset

dcterms:creator: T. Brox
J. Malik
dcterms:description: The Large Displacement Optical Flow (LDOF) dataset focuses on descriptor matching in variational motion estimation, addressing large displacement issues.
dcterms:title: Large Displacement Optical Flow (LDOF)

dcterms:creator: L. Xu
J. Jia
Y. Matsushita
dcterms:description: The MDP dataset focuses on motion detail preserving optical flow estimation, providing a basis for evaluating algorithms in non-rigid scenarios.
dcterms:title: MDP (Motion Detail Preserving)

dcterms:creator: W. Li
D. Cosker
M. Brown
R. Tang
dcterms:description: The LME dataset utilizes Laplacian mesh energy for optical flow estimation, focusing on non-rigid surface motion.
dcterms:title: LME (Laplacian Mesh Energy)

dcterms:creator: V. Markandey
B. E. Flinchbaugh
dcterms:description: The MCOF dataset introduces multispectral constraints for optical flow computation, enhancing the evaluation of optical flow algorithms.
dcterms:title: MCOF (Multispectral Constraints for Optical Flow Computation)

dcterms:creator: J. Barron
R. Klette
dcterms:description: The COF dataset provides a quantitative approach to color optical flow, allowing for the evaluation of optical flow algorithms in color images.
dcterms:title: COF (Color Optical Flow)
